com.anji.util

Class Properties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • com.anji.util.Properties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Properties

    public class Properties
extends java.util.Properties
    Beefed up version of java.util.Properties used to manage configuration parameters. Adds convenience functions for converting String properties to various data types and logs all default and configured property settings.
    Author:
    Philip Tucker
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getObjectFromArgsProperty

        public <T> T getObjectFromArgsProperty(java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                              double[] defaultArgs)
        Retrieve an array of Objects initialised from a comma-separated list of double arguments wrapped in brackets. E.g. (0.0, 2.3), (4, 0.002) would create two Objects. Note that the constructors for clazz must have arguments that are all doubles.

      • getObjectFromArgsProperty

        public <T> T getObjectFromArgsProperty(java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                              T defaultObject,
                              double[] defaultArgs)
        Retrieve an array of Objects initialised from a comma-separated list of double arguments wrapped in brackets. E.g. (0.0, 2.3), (4, 0.002) would create two Objects. Note that the constructors for clazz must have arguments that are all doubles.

      • getObjectArrayProperty

        public <T> T[] getObjectArrayProperty(java.lang.String key,
                             java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                             T[] defaultObjects,
                             double[] defaultArgs)
        Retrieve an array of Objects initialised from a comma-separated list of double arguments wrapped in brackets. E.g. (0.0, 2.3), (4, 0.002) would create two Objects. Note that the constructors for clazz must have arguments that are all doubles.

      • getSubProperties

        public Properties getSubProperties(java.lang.String prefix)
        Return properties filtered for a particular sub-component, based on prefix.
        Parameters:
        prefix -
        Returns:
        Properties object properties contained in this object, but for those cases where the property starts with prefix, the property overrides another property of the same key; e.g., if prefix is "abc", and there is an "abc.foo=bar" property and a "foo=bat" property, this method returns a properties object containing "foo=bar"

      • getOnlySubProperties

        public Properties getOnlySubProperties(java.lang.String prefix)
        Return properties filtered for a particular sub-component.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The top-level property for which to get the sub-properties.
        Returns:
        A Properties object containing key/value pairs from this Properties object for which the keys in this Properties object start with the given prefix, with the keys in the returned Properties object stripped of the prefix.

      • newObjectListProperty

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> newObjectListProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                                     java.util.List<java.lang.Object> defaultList)
        Return list of objects initialized from properties. Each object has a name given in a comma-separated list in property value for key. Each object, if it is Configurable, is initialized with properties prefixed with its name, plus remainder of properties. The class of each object is determined by a property named object name +CLASS_SUFFIX
        Parameters:
        key -
        defaultList - returns this if no property key exists
        Returns:
        List contains initialized objects

      • newObjectListProperty

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> newObjectListProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Throws IllegalArgumentException exception if key not present.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        List contains initialized objects
        See Also:
        newObjectListProperty(String, List)

      • getEnumProperty

        public <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> T getEnumProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                              java.lang.Class<T> enumType,
                                              T def)
        Parameters:
        key - The property name to retrieve the value for.
        enumType - the class of the Enum to get a value for.
        def - The default value to return if the given key has not been defined in this Properties object.
        Returns:
        the enum constant of the specified enum type with the name specified by the value for the specified property. Specifically. The value is converted to uppercase.

      • getEnumProperty

        Returns:
